composition.Programmer 1: Implement the backend code in `app.py` to handle routing for all frontend pages and manage file read/write operations for user credentials, projects, blogs, and contacts. Fix the login functionality to handle POST requests correctly by checking the provided credentials against the stored user data. Upon successful login, store the username in the session to allow access to the portfolio, blog, and contact pages. Ensure that the login page can be accessed through the local port 5000.
composition.Programmer 2: Develop the frontend code for the Login Page in `login.html` that allows users to enter their credentials (username and password) to access the site. Ensure that the element IDs are as follows  Input Field for Username `login_username`, Input Field for Password `login_password`, Login Button `login_button`, Error Message Display Area `login_error_message`, Redirect Link to Register `link_register`. All URLs in the frontend code should be routes, not HTML file names.
composition.Programmer 3: Develop the frontend code for the Registration Page in `register.html` that facilitates new users in creating an account by filling out a form with their details. Ensure that the element IDs are as follows  Input Field for Email `reg_email`, Input Field for Username `reg_username`, Input Field for Password `reg_password`, Register Button `reg_button`. All URLs in the frontend code should be routes, not HTML file names.
composition.Programmer 4: Develop the frontend code for the Portfolio Page in `portfolio.html` that displays the user's uploaded projects, including links and descriptions. Ensure that the element IDs are as follows  Section for Project List `project_list`, Input Field for New Project Link `new_project_link`, Input Field for Project Description `new_project_description`, Add Project Button `add_project_button`, Delete Project Button (for each project) `delete_project_button`, Blog Button `blog_button`, Contact Button `contact_button`. All URLs in the frontend code should be routes, not HTML file names.
composition.Programmer 5: Develop the frontend code for the Blog Page in `blog.html` that contains a space for users to write and share blog posts. Ensure that the element IDs are as follows  Section for Blog Posts `blog_posts`, Input Field for Blog Title `blog_title`, Input Field for Blog Content `blog_content`, Publish Blog Button `publish_blog_button`, Delete Blog Button (for each blog) `delete_blog_button`. All URLs in the frontend code should be routes, not HTML file names.
composition.Programmer 6: Develop the frontend code for the Contact Page in `contact.html` that provides a contact form for users to send messages. Ensure that the element IDs are as follows  Input Field for Name `contact_name`, Input Field for Email `contact_email`, Textarea for Message `contact_message`, Send Message Button `send_message_button`. All URLs in the frontend code should be routes, not HTML file names.
